geom_bar:
geom_bar

displays bars, with height proportional to the number of cases in each group.
geom_bin2d:
geom_bin2d

displays rectangular bins (heatmap of 2d bin counts).
geom_boxplot:
geom_boxplot

displays box and whiskers plot. The lower and upper "hinges" correspond to the first and third quartiles (the 25th and 75th percentiles).
geom_density:
geom_density

displays a smooth kernel density estimate.
geom_density2d:
geom_density2d

displays contours from a 2d density estimate (2D kernel density estimation using kde2d).
geom_freqpoly:
geom_freqpoly

displays frequency polygons. Uses lines to display a 1d distribution by dividing into bins and counting the number of observations in each bin.
geom_histogram:
geom_histogram

displays a histogram. Uses bars to display a 1d distribution by dividing into bins and counting the number of observations in each bin.
geom_jitter:
geom_jitter

displays points, jittered to reduce overplotting.

The jitter is added in both positive and negative directions, so the total spread is twice the value specified here. If width or height are omitted, they default to 40% of the resolution of the data: this means the jitter values will occupy 80% of the implied bins.

Categorical data is aligned on the integers, so a width or height of 0.5 will spread the data so it's not possible to see the distinction between the categories.
geom_point:
geom_point

displays points, as for a scatterplot.
geom_smooth:
geom_smooth

displays smooth of y=f(x), and 95% confidence intervals around smooth. For datasets with n < 1000 the smoothing method is loess. For datasets with n > 1000 or more observations the smoothing method is a generalized additive model (GAM).
stat_summary:
stat_summary

summarises y values at unique/binned x
